etymologies: Old English lungen, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch long and German Lunge, from an Indo-European root shared by light; compare with lights

definitions: each of the pair of organs situated within the rib cage, consisting of elastic sacs with branching passages into which air is drawn, so that oxygen can pass into the blood and carbon dioxide be removed. Lungs are characteristic of vertebrates other than fish, though similar structures are present in some other animal groups.
shortDefinitions: each of pair of organs with branching passages into which air is drawn

definitions: an open space in a town or city, where people can breathe fresher air

examples.text: the city had to be given lungs, in the shape of open spaces, squares, parks, and gardens

shortDefinitions: open spaces in town or city
